SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ecs.utils.stellent
Class LWDocument

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.stellent.LWDocument
public class LWDocument
extends java.lang.Object

The LWDocument provides a lightweight mechanism for working with documents in a Stellent Content Server. Utilises the IdcServerBean package.

Code Example:

// This sample creates a new content item in stellent, checks it out
// then checks a new revision back in. The title is modified between
// revisions and each check in call is done synchronously.

File content = new File("c:\\test_file.doc");

// Connecting to the local Stellent instance
LWDocument doc = new LWDocument();

doc.setTitle("Test document " + new Date());
doc.setDocName("TEST_" + new Date().getTime());
doc.setDocType("Document");
doc.setSecurityGroup("Public");

System.out.println("Doing intial checkin");
System.out.println("Checked in with docname: " + doc.checkin(content, true));
System.out.println("Document title/revision: " + doc.getTitle() + "/" + doc.getAttribute("drevisionid"));
System.out.println("Doing checkout");
doc.checkout();

System.out.println("Doing second checkin");
doc.setTitle(doc.getTitle() + " - 2nd checkin");
System.out.println("Checked in with did: " + doc.checkin(content, true));
System.out.println("Document title/revision: " + doc.getTitle() + "/" + doc.getAttribute("drevisionid"));

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gordon Sandeman

Constructor Detail

LWDocument

public LWDocument()
Constructor for a LWDocument object. Use this constructor when creating a new Stellent content item. A Stellent connection as sysadmin to a local instance on port 4444 is established. To specify different connection information use the appropriate constructor.

LWDocument

public LWDocument(LWFacade f)
Constructor for a LWDocument object. Use this constructor when creating a new Stellent content item. The Stellent connection on the passed LWFacade object is used.

           throws java.lang.Exception

LWDocument

public LWDocument(java.lang.String server,
                  java.lang.String user,
                  java.lang.String port)
Constructor for a LWDocument object with Stellent connection information specified. Use this constructor when creating a new Stellent content item. The Stellent server name, Stellent user and server port are all specified in the call.

Parameters:
server - Stellent server host name
user - Stellent user name
port - Stellent Content Server port

setDocName

public void setDocName(java.lang.String s)
Sets the document's dDocName. Use the checkin method to commit these changes.
Note: For Stellent systems where the dDocName (ContentID) is automatically allocated it is not necessary to specify a dDocName.

Parameters:
s - The document's dDocName (ContentID)

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(java.lang.String attribute,
                         java.lang.String value)
Sets the requested attribute. If the attribute is already set its value is overwritten.

Parameters:
attribute - Attribute name to store (case sensitive)
value - Value to assign to the attribute

setAttributes

public void setAttributes(java.util.Hashtable attrs)
Sets the requested attributes contained in the passed Hashtable. The key is taken as the attribute name, the value as the attribute value. If any of the attributes are already set their value will be overwritten.

Parameters:
attrs - Hashtable containing attributes to store (case sensitive)

Throws:

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.io.File file)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new revision of the document setting the document's content to the passed file. The revision label is incremented (if this is a checkin of an existing document) and the release date updated to the current date and time.

Parameters:
file - Document content
Returns:
If this is the first revision of a new document the dDocName is returned otherwise the dID of the new document revision is returned
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.io.File primaryFile,
                                java.io.File altFile)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new revision of the document setting the document's content to the passed file. The revision label is incremented (if this is a checkin of an existing document) and the release date updated to the current date and time.

Parameters:
primaryFile - Document content
altFile - Web-viewable content (can be null)
Returns:
If this is the first revision of a new document the dDocName is returned otherwise the dID of the new document revision is returned
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.io.File primaryFile,
                                java.io.File altFile,
                                boolean runSynchronously)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.io.File primaryFile,
                                boolean runSynchronously)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new revision of the document setting the document's content to the passed file. The revision label is incremented (if not a new checkin) and the release date updated to the current date and time. Setting runSynchronously to true ensures that the method does not return until the checked in document has been checked in and indexed.
Note: If checking in a new revision of an existing document the checkin process will automatically increment the Revision Label by 1.

Parameters:
runSynchronously -
Returns:
If this is the first revision of a new document the dDocName is returned otherwise the dID of the new document revision is returned
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.io.File primaryFile,
                                boolean runSynchronously,
                                boolean touchReleaseDate)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new revision of the document setting the document's content to the passed file. The revision label is incremented (if not a new checkin) and the release date updated to the current date and time. Setting runSynchronously to true ensures that the method does not return until the checked in document has been checked in and indexed.
Setting tourchReleaseDate to false ensures that the revision release date is not automatically set to the current date/time. Note: If checking in a new revision of an existing document the checkin process will automatically increment the Revision Label by 1.

Parameters:
primaryFile - Document content
runSynchronously -
touchReleaseDate -
Returns:
If this is the first revision of a new document the dDocName is returned otherwise the dID of the new document revision is returned
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.io.File primaryFile,
                                java.io.File altFile,
                                boolean runSynchronously,
                                boolean touchReleaseDate)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new revision of the document setting the document's content to the passed file. The revision label is incremented (if not a new checkin) and the release date updated to the current date and time. Setting runSynchronously to true ensures that the method does not return until the checked in document has been checked in and indexed.
Setting tourchReleaseDate to false ensures that the revision release date is not automatically set to the current date/time. Note: If checking in a new revision of an existing document the checkin process will automatically increment the Revision Label by 1.

Parameters:
primaryFile - Document content
altFile - Web-viewable content (optional)
runSynchronously -
touchReleaseDate -
Returns:
If this is the first revision of a new document the dDocName is returned otherwise the dID of the new document revision is returned
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reinitialise

public void reinitialise()
Method to reinitialise object as a new document. All existing attribute information is lost.

reinitialise

public void reinitialise(java.lang.String docName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Method to reinitialise object. All existing attribute information is lost and refreshed from the Stellent Content Server.

Parameters:
docName - The dDocName of the content item
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If Stellent object does not exist

reinitialiseConnection

public void reinitialiseConnection()
Method to reinitialise the underlying Stellent Content Server connection.

dumpAttributes

public java.lang.String dumpAttributes()
Dumps out all currently set LWDocument attributes as a string in the form:

attribute name1=attribute value1
attribute name2=attribute value2
...

Returns:
String containing attribute list

logAttributes

public java.lang.String logAttributes()
Dumps out all currently set LWDocument attributes as a string on a single line to be added to a log file. The string has the form:

{attributeName1=attributeValue1 attribute name2=attribute value2...}

Returns:
String containing attribute list

update

public void update()
            throws java.lang.Exception
Calls the UPDATE_DOCINFO service on this document.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

forceUpdate

public void forceUpdate()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Calls the UPDATE_DOCINFO_LATEST service on this document.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
